componentInstanceProperties.name: summaryText
componentInstanceProperties.value: An affordable, secure alternative to traditional home ownership or renting

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Key Investment Highlights

  • Market - high growth with significant addressable market (over 2.1m+ households, ABS) and positive social impact
  • Only financier offering land lease home loans in Australia. Banks do not offer this product
  • Platform - first mover advantage provides competitive moat and proprietary customer acquisition channel with operators providing low cost of customer acquisition
  • Funding and Management - high conviction management with debt funding in place and blue-chip institutional investors including Ingenia Communities Group and an institutional impact investor
  • Demand - Australia’s rental market has grown to over 27%, approximately 36,000+ new social and affordable homes are needed each year and the build-to-rent market cannot keep pace with demand

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The Offer

Seed Preference Shares @ $1.40 per share (pre-money valuation of $9,031,583)

Land Lease Home Loans is offering investors the opportunity to invest in a company that is supported by strong tailwinds, leveraged to sector dynamics, including the growing ageing population and growing under-serviced housing solutions.

The lead financier to the land lease sector in the US is 21st Mortgage Corporation, ultimately owned by Berkshire Hathaway. The US market is deep and mature with an equivalent land lease housing option that extends beyond over 50s to family or all-ages communities.

Land Lease Home Loans expects to lead the investment thesis for Australian operators to produce an all-ages housing product that will compete with Build-To-Rent and provide a solution to Australia’s affordable housing crisis.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Growth Strategy

Land Lease Home Loans’ growth will come from:

  • establishing contractual relationships with top tier land lease operators that enhance the security provided by the borrower
  • growing the loan book responsibly with high-quality customers, and
  • reduced funding costs to generate a positive Net Interest Margin

As the first mover in the Australian market, Land Lease Home Loans is well-positioned to deliver on each of these objectives.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Use of Funds and Exit Strategy

Funds of $1.99m already raised in this $3m round have been largely deployed to establish the debt facility, including a first loss tranche to support loan originations and an interest coverage reserve. The structure put in place is a typical warehouse structure (within a master security trust).

They will use the balance of funds raised for working capital over the course of the next 12 months.

Further investor interest is being sought from strategic capital partners that can bring value to the company, including a lower capital costs.

The exit for investors is likely via a sale to a financial institution that recognises the value of entering this growth sector and the embedded value of the customer base (At least one major Australian bank is expecting to fund $10b of affordable housing projects by 2030). The investment horizon is inherently uncertain but they are targeting a liquidity event for shareholders within 3 to 5 years.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
What is Land Lease Home Loans?

Land Lease Home Loans is the only financier in the market that can provide a loan secured by a home in select land lease communities.

Their mission is to promote the land lease community sector as an equal or better alternative to a traditional home. Their purpose is to give all Australians the opportunity to experience resort-style living in a land lease community.

An Australian owned company, Land Lease Home Loans is built upon the principle of doing the right thing by its customers, land lease communities and stakeholders. Land Lease Home Loans provides a direct social impact by contributing to positive lifestyle changes in a sector that delivers an affordable long-term housing option.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Problem & Market

The land lease sector has seen high levels of interest from institutional investors given the strong sector dynamics of a growing ageing population, under-serviced housing options and consumers seeking greater levels of lifestyle that land lease communities provide.

From an investment perspective, land lease communities provide the dual benefit of delivering development margins typically comparable to residential, coupled with long-term annuity income associated with the land lease rents. Recognisable names of recent entrants include Stockland and Mirvac.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
The sector has historically targeted self-funded retirees with the average entry age into a community in the late 60s and average home price of 〜$475,000. However, the sector is undergoing a transformation with developers expanding their addressable market and catering to a premium buyer, with homes valued between $700k and $1m+. The appeal of a land lease community is also generating increased interest from a younger over 50s demographic as they seek to experience resort-style living sooner than retirement.

It is estimated that a further 26,500+ new homes will need to be built by 2026 just to keep up with demand in the over 50s sector.

Prior to the launch of Land Lease Home Loans, a purchaser of a land lease home required 100% of the equity as no loan product was available apart from loans from friends and family and higher priced unsecured personal loans that are typically capped at $50k.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Land Lease Home Loans Solution

Land Lease Home Loans is the only financier in the market that can provide a loan secured against a home in a land lease community and represents the first ever home loan solution in Australia for land lease community residents.

The concept for the business was born when founder and former State Director of NSW Health for Australia and New Zealand Bank, Andrew Ralph, witnessed a funding gap in the Australian market that has been successfully addressed in the US for decades.

Key features of the loan product currently available to customers include:

  • Maximum LVR 40%
  • Debt to Income <3.0x and a good to excellent Equifax credit score
  • Maximum loan amount $250,000 and a 10-year term
  • Serviced from sustainable income (not pension) and supported by other assets such as superannuation and investments
  • Secured by the land lease home with a personal guarantee available to contribute to the repayment of the loan in the event of default

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Competitive Advantage

Land Lease Home Loans has developed IP that creates a bankable asset class thanks to the founder’s extensive land lease community sector expertise and banking background as well as the assistance of founding shareholder, Ingenia Communities Group (ASX top 100 company with ticker: INA).

A land lease home loan is secured by a Personal Property Security Registration (PPSR under the Commonwealth Government’s Personal Property Security Act) over the home and the site agreement. It is a valid and enforceable security interest and is the same type of security a financier would take over a car or caravan, for example. The borrower also provides a personal guarantee, which is common to most financial products in the market.

The competitive advantage lies in the enhanced security package agreement with the operator of a land lease community. This agreement governs the interaction between Land Lease Home Loans, the land lease operator and, importantly, the resident of that community and our customer.

It is this innovation that will help expand the addressable market for land lease home ownership, while providing a barrier to entry to LLHL’s competitors looking to enter the market.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Why Invest Through VentureCrowd?

VentureCrowd is the leading digital investment platform for alternative assets. We are here to prove investments can be accessible and impactful.

Our curation and due diligence is rigorous and our track record of success speaks for itself:

  • Only digital investment platform in Australia to have successfully delivered exit returns to investors through equity crowdfunding.

  • 70K+ members and counting.

  • Over $270,000,000 in capital raised since inception.

VentureCrowd is investor-led, which means we only list deals with secured professional external lead investors. Our investors then invest on the same economic terms as professional investors. If you invest in one of our deals you will receive equity or ownership in the company that is raising the capital. Not only will your investment come with lower fees and capital commitments, but it will also come with reduced deal complexity, and you’ll have access to alternative equity, property and credit opportunities on the same terms as professional lead investors.

Invest now

If you would prefer to speak to one of our team members about this offer, please:

  • email us at hello@venturecrowd.com.au or

  • call us on 1300 039 655

Please note, the Fund Manager reserves the right to vary or cancel the Offer at any time, vary the amount raised under the Offer, vary or waive the Minimum Investment and close the Offer, without notice and without giving reasons.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Fees

Investors invest through a VentureCrowd Trust, which is managed as a single asset by VentureCrowd. We charge an annual management fee to investors, payable on exit and we only charge a performance fee where an exit delivers profit, thereby aligning ourselves with the outcomes for investors.

  • Contribution Fee: 1.1% This is the fee charged by the Trustee for the establishment of the Trust and the purchasing entity, structuring the overall investment and raising capital by way of issue of Units. Payable upon acceptance of your investment by the Trustee.
  • Management Fee: 1.65%/PA (charged on conversion or exit)
  • Performance Fee: 20% of the profit. We only charge a performance fee on conversion or exit.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Risks

Investing in private companies is risky. Issuers using this facility include new or rapidly growing ventures. Investment in these types of ventures is speculative and carries high risks. You may lose your entire investment, and you should be in a position to bear this risk without undue hardship. Even if the company is successful, the value of your investment and any return on the investment could be reduced if the company issues more shares. Your investment is unlikely to be liquid. This means you are unlikely to be able to sell your shares quickly or at all if you need the money or decide that this investment is not right for you. Even though you have remedies for misleading statements in the offer document or misconduct by the company, you may have difficulty recovering your money. There are rules for handling your money. However, if your money is handled inappropriately or the person operating this platform becomes insolvent, you may have difficulty recovering your money. Ask questions, read all information given carefully, and seek independent financial advice before committing yourself to any investment.
